column4: Hello! How can I make the gnome-panel transparent? It's nearly transparent, but not quite. None of the many threads I've found online have helped.
I'll post a screenshot once it uploads.
I'm using a custom theme
you can create a transparent image in gimp and use that as the background image
you want this completely transparent?
Um, well, sort of. http://bayimg.com/HAEpaaAda
Same problem with the transparent background from gimp. I've already tried that
well I would need to know how transparent you want this or which almost transparent colour you want
If you look at the screenshot, the bottom panel is the one I've tried to make transparent.
It's nearly transparent, but there is a horizontal line where the panel goes to the wallpaper.
Very faint, but annoying ;-)
try this one    http://dl.dropbox.com/u/132551/trans.tar.gz
I tried that one and it doesnt seem to have any indication it is there
same problem.
mm
Looks identical to the screenshot
then I am not sure where to go from there
(the screenshot I provided)
I have been fighting this problem for quite a while.
I suppose I will have to abandon the battle :-)
I am sure it is possible  I just never worked with it
